result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler K Ruehl was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: APPLY $300.00 BAIL. Balance to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 2/01/2017 along with payment plan fee of $15.00, along with case 15CF165.
DNA paid along with fine on payment plan with case 15CF165.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Tyler K Ruehl in court with attorney Bradley Jay Dagen.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to the charge in the amended information.  Court imposed the following sentence:

Fine $379.00
DNA Surcharge $200
Defendant to pay $50.00 a month commencing 02/01/2017 or alternate of 7 days 
Apply any bail posted
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tyler K Ruehl in court with attorney Bradley Jay Dagen.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment for his client to complete the 180 program.  Court grants.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
